description: Inoculate with Rc212 yeast at 20°C. Use 20g/hL dry yeast rehydrated at 35°C
Check fermentation temperature - maintain 18-22°C
Check for H2S smell (rotten egg). Pinot Noir is HIGH RISK varietal
Measure Brix (expect ~24). Record gravity for 1/3 completion tracking
Add DAP (Di-ammonium phosphate) at 1/3 sugar depletion (~16 Brix). Apply 75-150 mg/L
Punch down cap 2x daily (morning + evening). Duration 30-40 minutes each
Daily H2S monitoring - critical for Pinot Noir
Maintain 18-22°C. Increase ventilation if above 22°C
Check Brix at 1/2 fermentation (~12 Brix)
Add yeast nutrient if fermentation slowing (apply 0.5g/L Fermaid K or equivalent)
Continue punch-down 2x daily through fermentation
H2S monitoring continues daily
Monitor Brix approaching dry (~2-3 Brix)
Assess color, tannin extraction, cap condition
Final gravity check (<1 Brix = dry)
Add SO2 after press. Target 50-75 mg/L free SO2
Press pomace. Separate free run and press wines
Initial racking off gross lees after pressing
Inoculate with malolactic bacteria (optional for Pinot Noir, enhances complexity)
Final check - monitor MLF progress over next 2-3 months
